questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You receive a tab-delimited data file name sales.tsv.

You need to connect to the file.

Which option should you select in Tableau Desktop?

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. A hierarchy of Category and Subcategory
Answer is correct. Create hierarchy is the solution.

choices.D: A group of Category and Subcategory
choices.C: A set for Category and a set for Subcategory
choices.B: A hierarchy of Category and Subcategory
choices.A: A calculated field that concatenates Category and Subcategory

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
given answer is correct

questions.question_text:
You have a dataset that contains sales data. The following is a sample of the data.

//IMG//


You need to return a value of TRUE if a month has sales greater than $50,000. otherwise the formula must return a value of FALSE.

Which two formulas achieve the goal? (Choose two.)

You have the following table.

//IMG//


You need each record to alternate between grey and white.

What should you change in the Format Shading pane?

discussion.content: Row banding size to 3 is the correct one. tested

comments.content:
After you are told EACH row should alternate? Read the requirement again.
"EACH" is the magic word there.

discussion.content: Each row should alternate between grey and white. I think C is the correct answer
Row banding size to 3 is a correct answer

Selected Answer: BE
string can be used to filter as text-based value.

it could also be boolean if we were to mention quantity greater or less than 50 in parameter , an integer if we choose the quantity as a parameter and a string if the customer names are used as a parameter

Selected Answer: BC
B. Integer
C. Float

comments.content: BE, i change my earlier submission :)

discussion.content:
I would say AE. 
My thinking is that we are after the customers name and if they are eligible for discount or not.

Selected Answer: BE
string and integer
